1 Atoms

1.1.1 Button: base

Markup

<button type="submit" class="sr-btn [modifier class]">Button</button>
<a href="#" class="sr-btn [modifier class]">Button</a>
Button
.sr-btn--disabled
Disabled button. If you use <button> element, that is acceptable to add disabled attribute instead.
Button

1.1.2 Button: skin

Markup

<button class="sr-btn [modifier class]">Button</button>
<a href="#" class="sr-btn [modifier class]">Button</a>
Button
.sr-btn--primary
Primary button
Button
.sr-btn--secondary
Secondary button
Button

1.1.3 Button: sizing

Fancy larger or smaller buttons? Add the following modifier class demonstrated below

Markup

<button class="sr-btn [modifier class]">Button</button>
<button class="sr-btn sr-btn--primary [modifier class]">Button</button>
<button class="sr-btn sr-btn--secondary [modifier class]">Button</button>
.sr-btn--large
Large button.
.sr-btn--small
Small button.
.sr-btn--mini
Mini button.
.sr-btn--block
Block level button.

1.2.1 Label: base

Markup

<label for="example-input" class="sr-label [modifier class]">Field label</label>
.sr-label--disabled
Disabled label to belonging disabled field.

1.3.1 Input: base

Markup

<input type="text" placeholder="text" class="sr-input " />
<input type="text" value="Not allowed" placeholder="text" class="sr-input " disabled />
Created using kss-node and kss-node-template.
